Method Detail

addWorkingDaysToDate

public static java.util.Date addWorkingDaysToDate(java.util.Date date,
                                                  int days)
Adds the given number of working days to the given date. A working day is specified as a regular Norwegian working day, excluding weekends and all national holidays.

Example 1:
- Add 5 working days to Wednesday 21.03.2007 -> Yields Wednesday 28.03.2007. (skipping saturday and sunday)

Example 2:
- Add 5 working days to Wednesday 04.04.2007 (day before easter-long-weekend) -> yields Monday 16.04.2007 (skipping 2 weekends and 3 weekday holidays).

Parameters:
date - The original date.
days - The number of working days to add.
Returns:
The new date.

isWorkingDay

public static boolean isWorkingDay(java.util.Date date)
Will check if the given date is a working day. That is check if the given date is a weekend day or a national holiday.

Parameters:
date - The date to check.
Returns:
true if the given date is a working day, false otherwise.

isHoliday

public static boolean isHoliday(java.util.Date date)
Check if given Date object is a holiday.

Parameters:
date - The Date to check.
Returns:
true if holiday, false otherwise.

getHolidays

public static java.util.Date[] getHolidays(int year)
Return a sorted array of holidays for a given year.

Parameters:
year - The year to get holidays for.
Returns:
The array of holidays, sorted by date.
